title: Can we make Ashe's Ulti visually freeze her enemies like Sej's?
body: Also give it an animation that wouldn't affect the cast time like Sej's

replies.body: I think RiotRepertoir mentioned that they unfortunately don't have time to go through her visuals for this update; the ChampUp team is pretty swamped with reworks; the only reason they were able to even do a minor Ashe rework was because a small window opened up in their schedule. They have mentioned they want to do something like this *eventually*, though it might be a while (apparently Taric's gameplay update is like 90% done, but the art team won't have time to finish him till Fall or Winter).

I sincerely hope that they pull a Heimerdinger with Taric and ship the kit portion of the rework while waiting for art assets (unless of course he has changed so dramatically that none of his old VFX work).

It's possible, but it seems like they want Taric to come out in pseudo-relaunch style, so it's likely they might wait. Of course, Taric isn't quite Sion-level in scale, it sounds like he's going to stick closer to his current theme than Sion did to his old theme, so it's possible they might release them separately

EDIT: A commenter on a reddit thread on the topic of Taric made a good point; it's likely his spells are going to be pretty different, so old VFXs, etc. probably aren't going to work for him (ie. Sion's Q. Another commenter pointed out Sion's ult with old Sion's model, which I think would be hilarious to watch XD)
Sion's stubby little legs pounding asphalt would be pretty much the funniest thing I've seen in league.
It's funny cos Rito released a full-on champion spotlight for Ashe last year when they 'reworked' her Passive.

I just found  the reason why my favorite ADC is almost perfect, she needs that freeze animation ..
Why? I mean it would look good, but it serves no purpose. Not trying to be rude, but I don't see the point in the visual. Could someone explain the benefit?

There isn't any benefit other than being able to tell that you're frozen. Also, the casting time takes off the time it takes to hit, and with many mobile champions it's hard enough to try to hit the arrow as it is since it's so easy to jump out of the way. The animations are what people look at it in the game. They try to match the animation of the abilities to the model. So adding a freezing animation would show how the enemy was frozen.
So, you want Ashe's ult to be more attractive? that's all. It's not really worth Riot's time to add an animation when her ult is perfectly fine without the animation

I guess so. I'm not really arguing too much for Ashe animations, considering that the more animations you have the more it lags your game. It's common sense that the more animation to process is the more it takes up and all. But it would be nice having something to visually show that the enemy is frozen when the arrow hits.
The only things I don't like about this is that the enemies become harder to distinguish.
Yes please.  I want to see someone get frozen by it.
